intro: Malaisia viridescens, commonly known as the green-flowered malaisia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
